profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:11:57 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs, clippings, writings, and publications relating to the Federal Art Project in California, particularly San Francisco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 1, frames 752-767: Correspondence and lists relating to exhibitions of works by San Francisco artists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 2: Articles from the San Francisco Art Association BULLETIN, 1934-1940 and MAGAZINE OF ART, October 1937.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 3(frames 13-20): Exhibtion catalog of Federal Art Project work at the University of California, Berkeley, Art Gallery, 1936.[Microfilm title University of California Art Gallery]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 14: Clippings, photographs, and press releases relating to the decoration by the FAP of the Enlisted Men's Club at Fort Ord, California; and photographs and biographical information relating to about 20 artists employed by FAP in Northern California.[Microfilm title Fort Ord, California and WPA-FAP, San Francisco]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 17: Photographs of sculpture, murals, easel work, graphics, and other works of art by various artists working for the FAP in California; and a list of artists on the Graphic Arts Project, San Francisco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 20: Photographs of artists and works of art for the FAP in San Francisco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 27: One publication of the University of California's Medical School murals, 1939; one photograph of project personnel, San Francisco; one newspaper article: "Bernard Zakheim and the U.C. Medical School," December 6, 1964.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels NDA 1, NDA 2, NDA 14, NDA 17, NDA 20, & NDA 27 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to respective lenders after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Federal aid art project during the Depression. The Federal Art Project (FAP) fell under the jurisdiction of Federal Project No. 1 of the Works Progress Administration (WPA). Established in May 1935 specifically as a work relief program for unemployed artists. Each state and territory had its own programs and were administered aid from the federal government via a local agency.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Material on reels NDA 1, NDA 3, NDA 14, NDA 17, NDA 20 and NDA 27 lent for microfilming 1964 by Lewis Ferbrache; and material on reel NDA 2 lent for microfilming 1964 by Marian Simpson.

odd.head: Other Title
odd.p: Fort Ord, California [microfilm title, reel NDA 14]

odd.head: Other Title
odd.p: WPA-FAP, San Francisco [microfilm title, reel NDA 14]
